title: Perfect Summer Fruit Salad Recipe
description: This fantastic fruit salad combines pineapple, kiwi, bananas, oranges, grapes, and berries in a sweet citrusy sauce for a colorful summer dessert.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Fruit Salad Recipes Perfect Summer Fruit Salad 4.8 (576) 424 Reviews 91 Photos This fruit salad is perfect for a backyard bbq party or any occasion. There are never leftovers! This is one of my favorite fruit salad recipes, as I think the citrusy sauce really makes it. This salad is tastier the longer you can let it soak in its juices. I prefer 3 to 4 hours in the refrigerator before I serve it. Submitted by Nicole Graham Holley Updated on April 8, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 91 91 91 91 Prep Time: 25 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Additional Time: 3 hrs Total Time: 3 hrs 30 mins Servings: 10 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This fruit salad recipe is bright, colorful, and incredibly delicious. How to Make Fruit Salad You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Fruit Salad Ingredients These are the ingredients you'll need for this top-rated fruit salad recipe: · For the sauce: fresh orange and lemon juices, brown sugar, grated orange and lemon zests, and vanilla extract.· The fruit you'll need: pineapple, strawberries, kiwis, bananas, oranges, grapes, and blueberries. Of course, this is a super customizable recipe — you can omit certain fruits or add other fruits to suit your taste and what you have on hand! How to Make a Fruit Salad Here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this easy fruit salad: 1. Make the sauce on the stove and let it cool.2. Arrange the fruits in a container, then pour the sauce over them.3. Cover and refrigerate to allow the flavors to meld. Can You Make Fruit Salad Ahead of Time? Yes! This fruit salad is actually a great make-ahead recipe, as the flavors need time to meld in the fridge before serving. Make the dish the day before, then store it in an airtight container in the refrigerator until you're ready to serve it. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I made this yesterday and it was the talk of the party," says Debbie Cash. "EVERYONE loved it. I did not change a thing. One change — I did not layer it but mixed it all together and it was so beautiful mixed together." "Liked this fruit salad very much," says jjarvis5. "The sauce blended all the fruit nicely yet you still tasted each fruit. I started layering the fruits but when I added the sauce I mixed it all up." "Salad was delish and very bright and colorful," raves czitnick. "I used tangerine instead of orange segments and it was perfect." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings Citrus Sauce: ⅔ cup fresh orange juice ⅓ cup fresh lemon juice ⅓ cup packed brown sugar ½ teaspoon grated orange zest ½ teaspoon grated lemon zest 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Salad: 2 cups cubed fresh pineapple 2 cups strawberries, hulled and sliced 3 kiwi fruit, peeled and sliced 3 bananas, sliced 2 oranges, peeled and sectioned 1 cup seedless grapes 2 cups blueberries Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios To make the sauce: Bring orange juice, lemon juice, brown sugar, orange zest, and lemon zest to a boil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract. Set aside to cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Layer fruit in a large, clear glass bowl in this order: pineapple, strawberries, kiwi fruit, bananas, oranges, grapes, and blueberries. Pour cooled sauce over fruit; cover and refrigerate for 3 to 4 hours before serving. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,110 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 274 Calories 1g Fat 70g Carbs 4g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 274 % Daily Value * Total Fat 1g 1% Saturated Fat 0g 1% Cholesterol 0mg 0% Sodium 7mg 0% Total Carbohydrate 70g 25% Dietary Fiber 9g 31% Total Sugars 47g Protein 4g 7% Vitamin C 167mg 186% Calcium 89mg 7% Iron 1mg 6% Potassium 904mg 19% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Perfect Summer Fruit Salad 01 of 91 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 91 Photo by  Denise Cassetta 02/23/2025 A keeper! The sauce is very good. Don’t skip it. Made the day before and drizzled on the middle layers, saving most for the top as the recipe calls for. All different fruits can get expensive. Will make again, worth it. 03 of 91 Photo by  Bruce Faithwick 01/26/2025 Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser IT LOOKS JUST GREAT. I made changes based on I am serving at a Pot Luck luncheon for 30 people. So I increased the quantity of fruit and serving platter. I added blackberries on top. It would look even better in a glass bowl to see the layers. The sause is cooling and I will keep it in the fridge over-night to serve tomorrow. 04 of 91 Photo by  TealPan2092 07/02/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Came out perfect! Substituted Honey crisp apples for the bananas. The wonderful sauce with its subtle yet distinct flavor really brings it all together. Served for small family brunch along with scones & cream and egg casserole. Everyone asked if there was any fruit salad to take home! :) 05 of 91 Photo by  SturdyHam7749 05/27/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Huge party favorite...seems like a simple fruit salad but it's so much more 06 of 91 Photo by  UpbeatCurd4133 07/26/2023 I loved this fruit salad! Took it to 4th of July party and it was a hit. Will make it again. 07 of 91 Photo by  czitnick 05/15/2022 Salad was delish and very bright and colorful! I used tangerine instead of orange segments and it was perfect. 08 of 91 Photo by  Peggie Bruno 02/19/2022 I took this dish to a party of fourteen . Everyone loved it and asked for the recipe! It made my day. The hostess is a real italian foodie. This is the first fruit salad I have made with a sauce. I will surely make it again. Some of the guests were kidding about adding some vodka and lemoncello instead of the lemon juice. 09 of 91 Photo by  Ari 08/30/2021 10 of 91 Photo by  Brooke Penney 08/15/2021 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Summer Fruit Salad with Mint Dressing 28 Ratings Fresh Fruit Salad 12 Ratings Tangy Poppy Seed Fruit Salad 147 Ratings Fresh Fruit with Poppy Seed Dressing 35 Ratings Citrus Salad 6 Ratings Hot Fruit Salad 34 Ratings Watermelon Salad with Grapes and Citrus 9 Ratings Strawberry-Melon Summer Salad 32 Ratings Whole Wheat Rotini Pasta Salad 8 Ratings Honey Lime Fruit Salad 60 Ratings Boozy Fruit Salad Turkish Orange Salad with Mediterranean Dressing 2 Ratings Red, White, and Blueberry Fruit Salad 64 Ratings Watermelon Fruit Bowl 31 Ratings Mandarin Chicken Pasta Salad 356 Ratings Fresh Summer Fruit Salad 14 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
